title: 114_hr4302
content:
The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating all functions of the Bank as outlined in the Act. Functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. The Secretary must report this determination to Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act by administering and dissolving functions transferred to them, handling outstanding obligations of the Federal Government from terminated programs, and resolving any remaining affairs of the Bank. They can delegate functions as needed and must ensure that no positions or functions of the Bank exist after 60 days of its abolishment. Additionally, there are conforming amendments and repeals outlined in the Act. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including various sections from different Acts such as the Bank Export Services Act, Public Law 90-390, Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983, Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988, and title 31 of the United States Code. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related provisions are repealed, including changes to positions at level iii and iv in title 5 of the United States Code, and the elimination of the Office of Inspector General for the Bank as per the Inspector General Act of 1978. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related provisions are repealed, including changes to positions at level iii and iv in title 5 of the United States Code, and the elimination of the Office of Inspector General for the Bank as per the Inspector General Act of 1978. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the abolishment date. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress on other necessary amendments to Federal statutes resulting from this Act. SEC. 10. REFERENCES.

Any reference in Federal law, executive order, rule, regulation, or delegation of authority to a department or office is deemed to refer to the department or office to which the function is transferred.

SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS.

In this Act, "function" includes duty, power, authority, responsibility, and "office" includes any organizational entity.
